thread.title: Big 12 power rankings (9/30): TCU holds on to top spot after escaping Lubbock with win
thread.title_full: Big 12 power rankings (9/30): TCU holds on to top spot after escaping Lubbock with win | Dallas Morning News

author: Nick Castillo
title: Big 12 power rankings (9/30): TCU holds on to top spot after escaping Lubbock with win
text:
The Big 12 kicked off conference play with two games that went down to the wire. No. 20 Oklahoma State defeated Texas with a 40-yard game winning field goal from junior Ben Grogan while No. 4 TCU escaped Lubbock with a 55-52 win over Texas Tech.
Baylor, West Virginia and Kansas all played non-conference game while Kansas State and Iowa State had bye weeks. A full-slate of conference games begin Saturday.
Check out our fourth weekly installment of Big 12 power rankings below:
1. TCU Horned Frogs / Previous ranking: 1st / 4-0, 1-0 / Last week: 55-52 win over Texas Tech / This week: vs. Texas, 11 a.m., Saturday / Notable: Senior quarterback Trevone Boykin and senior wide receiver Josh Doctson had big days in the Horned Frogs' 55-52 win over the Red Raiders. Boykin threw for 485 yards and four touchdowns and added 42 rushing yards. Doctson earned the Walter Camp national player of the week honors after his 267 yards on 18 receptions and three touchdown performance. After surviving their game in Lubbock, the Horned Frogs return to Fort Worth for a match against the struggling Longhorns.
2. Baylor Bears / Previous ranking: 2nd / 3-0, 0-0/ Last week: 70-17 win over Rice / This week: vs. Texas Tech, 2:30 p.m., Saturday / Notable: The Bears took care of business against Rice. Junior quarterback Seth Russell threw six touchdowns in Baylor's 70-17 win over the Owls. The Bears' rushing attack ran for 427 yards led by junior running back Shock Linwood's 158 yards and one touchdown. Junior wide receiver Corey Coleman continued to shine. He had his third-straight 100 yard receiving game and scored three touchdowns against Rice. Baylor begins Big 12 play against Texas Tech at AT&T Stadium in Arlington on Saturday.
3. Oklahoma Sooners / Previous ranking: 3rd / 3-0, 0-0/ Last week: Bye/ This week: vs. West Virginia, 11 a.m., Saturday / Notable: After its bye week, Oklahoma has tough game at home against West Virginia. The Sooners will rely on junior Baker Mayfield who has thrown for 1062 yards, 10 touchdowns and two interceptions this season. The Sooners will also use sophomore running back Samaje Perine against the Mountaineers. Perine has run for 263 yards and two touchdowns. Oklahoma will try to get a good performance from its defense which has given 361 yards per game.
4. West Virginia Mountaineers / Previous ranking: 4th / 3-0, 0-0 / Last week: 45-6 win over Maryland / This week: at Oklahoma, 11 a.m., Saturday / Notable: The Mountaineers blew out Maryland on Saturday, 45-6. Junior quarterback Skyler Howard passed for 294 yards and four touchdowns against the Terrapins. Junior running back Wendell Smallwood had his best game of 2015 against Maryland. He ran for 147 yards and a touchdown Saturday. They'll travel to Oklahoma to take on the Sooners this weekend.
5. Oklahoma State Cowboys / Previous ranking: 5th / 4-0, 1-0 / Last week: 30-27 win over Texas / This week: vs. Kansas State, 3 p.m., Saturday / Notable: Oklahoma State had a rough game against Texas but Groban scored two late-game field goals to push it past the Longhorns. Sophomore quarterback Mason Rudolph threw two interceptions and had one lost fumble against Texas. The Cowboys were held to 103 rushing yards. Oklahoma State will have a tough matchup against Kansas State on Saturday.
6. Texas Tech Red Raiders / Previous ranking: 6th / 3-1, 0-1/ Last week: 55-52 loss to TCU / This week: vs. Baylor, 2:30 p.m., Saturday / Notable: Although the Red Raiders fell short of pulling the upset over TCU, they had a good day offensively. Sophomore quarterback Patrick Mahomes threw for 392 yards and two touchdowns. Texas Tech got a huge game from senior running back DeAndre Washington who amassed 188 rushing yards and four touchdowns. Senior wide receiver Jakeem Grant led the receiving charge with 126 yards and a touchdown. The Red Raiders have another tough game Saturday against Baylor at AT&T Stadium.
7. Kansas State Wildcats / Previous ranking: 7th / 3-0, 0-0 / Last week: Bye / This week: at Oklahoma State, 3 p.m., Saturday / Notable: The Wildcats travel to Oklahoma State after their bye week. After Kansas State lost its starting quarterback in its first game, junior Joe Hubener has stepped in and performed well. He's thrown four touchdowns and has yet to throw an interception. The Wildcats will rely on its defense against the Cowboys on Saturday. Kansas State's defense is ranked No. 32 in total defense and has given up 315.3 yards per game.
8. Texas Longhorns / Previous ranking: 8th / 1-3, 0-1 / Last week: 30-27 loss to Oklahoma State/ This week: at TCU 11 a.m., Saturday/ Notable: The Longhorns are reeling after two heartbreaking losses. Texas lost to California because of missed extra point on Sept. 19. A mishandled snap on a punt helped set up Oklahoma State's game-winning field goal. Despite the losses, the Longhorns have shown improvement. Texas has found a quarterback in redshirt freshman Jerrod Heard and its defense has improved after opening the season with a 38-3 loss to Notre Dame. The Longhorns have a challenge with TCU on Saturday.
9. Iowa State Cyclone / Previous ranking: 9th / 1-2, 0-0 / Last week: Bye / This week: vs. Kansas at 11 a.m. on Saturday / Notable: Iowa State takes on Kansas after a bye week. The Cyclones' quarterback Sam Richardson has thrown for 749 yards and five touchdowns in three games. Iowa State hasn't had much from its running game. Freshman running back Mike Warren leads the Cyclones with 154 yards. Iowa State will look to use its defense against the Jayhawks. The Cyclones are No. 56 in total defense this season.
10. Kansas Jayhawks / Previous ranking: 10th / 0-3, 0-0 / Last week: 27-14 loss to Rutgers / This week: at Kansas at 11 a.m. on Saturday / Notable: The Jayhawks' troubles continued Saturday in a 27-14 loss to Rutgers. Kansas won the turnover battle against the Scarlet Knights but was unable to capitalize with a win. The Jayhawks have a chance to change their fortunes when they take on Iowa State on Saturday.
